Based on your preference cues, I would recommend 'Music and Lyrics' (2007) to you.
This movie features music composed by Lin-Manuel Miranda, who is also an actor in the film. The lyrics of this music are written by Miranda himself.
The plot of this movie revolves around two musicians - one a piano player, the other a cellist - who are hired to compose new music for a wealthy businessman's daughter. However, upon arriving at the businessman's mansion, the two musicians discover that their task is actually to rewrite an existing composition - specifically, the daughter's own personal favorite song.
As the two musicians begin work on this rewritten composition, they quickly realize that the task of rewriting someone else's personal favorite song is not only much more difficult than the original task of composing new music for a wealthy businessman's daughter, but it also comes with an array of unique challenges - including dealing with the daughter's own personal feelings and emotions regarding her favorite song, as well as dealing with the daughter's own personal preferences when it comes to choosing which version of the daughter's favorite song she wants to listen to.
As the two musicians continue working on this rewritten composition, they quickly realize that despite the unique challenges associated with rewriting someone else's personal favorite song, it is still possible for them to successfully complete their task and rewrite an existing composition - specifically, the daughter's own personal favorite song - without any significant mistakes or errors being made along the way.
